Documentation¶

class symcirc.AnalyseCircuit(netlist, analysis_type='DC', symbolic=True)¶

Main SymCirc class. When initialized it parses input netlist, and conducts the desired analysis which is then stored as a set of equations in the equation_matrix variable.

Parameters

  • netlist (str) – Loaded netlist file which contains the circuit description. If you intend to load from a file, use the utils.load_file() function.

  • analysis_type (str) – Analysis type identifier: “DC”, “AC”, “TF”, “tran”.

  • symbolic (bool) – False if you want your results evaluated with numerical values from the netlist.

Raises

ValueError – If the analysis_type argument is invalid.

all_component_values()¶

Returns a dictionary of all relevant voltages and currents in the circuit.

Return dict ret

in format {“v(id1)” : value, “i(id2)” : value, …}

component_values(name)¶
Takes a string containing a single component name and returns a dictionary containing the voltage and current

of the input component.

Parameters

name (str) – component id

Return dict ret

in format {“v(name)” : value, “i(name)” : value}

count_components()¶

Returns the total number of components in the circuit

:return int count

node_voltages()¶

Returns a dictionary of all node voltages in the circuit.

Return dict ret

in format {“v(node1)” : value, …}

transfer_function(node1, node2)¶

Takes names of two nodes and returns their transfer function

Parameters

  • node1 (str) – node id

  • node2 (str) – node id

Return sympy_object ret

resulting transfer function
